Articles.Content:
I've been working on a page of NASA links on and off for about a year. They were originally in an HTML file for personal use, but I soon wanted to have it online. Seeing as I couldn't find anywhere that I could host the file for free (I'm a cheap SOB) I transferred it to google sites. It's basically a project to collect various useful, neat, and/or obscure NASA links, pages, and websites. I'm just posting it here so that it gets some exposure and as a "why not" sort of deal. I know self-advertisement is frowned upon but I figure that if devs of games on the forums make threads for their games and link to their site why can't I make a thread for my site? It's a bit smallish, but I hope to add links to it all the time. It's also my first venture into creating a website, so it might be a bit rough around the edges.

https://sites.google.com/site/nasalinksaktflyme/
Cool! But I feel like I've seen this before?
Your list of centers is missing Armstrong.

Your list of centers is missing Armstrong.

Thanks.

Really long and good list. I am getting a server soon, and when I get things figured out, I could host it for you for free. (Monthly server costs are really low due it being a rapsberry pi on my desk.)

Really long and good list. I am getting a server soon, and when I get things figured out, I could host it for you for free. (Monthly server costs are really low due it being a rapsberry pi on my desk.)

Thanks for the server offer, I might just take you up on that. I've always wanted a small website (A few pages & lots of files [Mainly .txt files under 10 kB] ) that's in HTML (Because I'm old fashioned) but the hosting costs wouldn't be justifiable. I'll have to get to building it; I've never built it because I didn't want to waste my time if I couldn't put it anywhere. Like you wouldn't build a house if you didn't have the land for it.

Edited September 18, 2015 by Flymetothemun

Thanks for the server offer, I might just take you up on that. I've always wanted a small website (A few pages & lots of files [Mainly .txt files under 10 kB] ) that's in HTML (Because I'm old fashioned) but the hosting costs wouldn't be justifiable. I'll have to get to building it; I've never built it because I didn't want to waste my time if I couldn't put it anywhere. Like you wouldn't build a house if you didn't have the land for it.

I am still waiting for the screen and keyboard to arrive. This is my first attempt at a server, so it might take some time to get it all figured out. I already found a cheap url (Drozd.com.de, less than a dollar per month) and I am hosting it on the newest raspberry pi. My internet is very fast, but I am in Europe, so there might just be some speed decrease. The server has 32 gigs of total memory, and is going to be used for teamspeak (maybe), personal email, irc chat and websites. If it's not enough I could connect a decently fast drive to it.
